--0-939319018-1152561999=:21230
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

You dont need any money to try it out, the demo is free forever. Just install it and you can use it on any 30 second length wav which is good for most evp's.
   
  I may end up getting the full version later just bvecause I'd like to support the program and maybe use it on longer wavs but for now 30 seconds is plenty to do my sessions.
   
  They know its 30 seconds, and they make use of it. They sometimes even announce it to the others at the start of the session like this file i attached. 
   
  Just remember its ok if you dont hear what I hear or the others hear. Sometimes messages arent meant for everyone. Sometimes they are just for your ears only...literally. Everyone hears different tones and some have strength in hearing high tones while others are more comfortable in the deeper bass. It's part of what makes evp so controversial. 
   
  I choose to think of it as everyones brain is wired different and each persons senses also differ whether its the known senses like seeing and hearing or the unknown senses. You all vibrate on your own levels and occasionally find others who can sync up at the same level of vibration. In this world and after. So just keep trying and look for your guides, they can help you with the process. Look for someone familiar to start off with because if they care for you they will hook you up on that side with the right group. You will need those you can trust because there are alot of unsavory types and they can help protect you from some of it.
   
  Misty

Amy Swanson <lon3_s7ar@...> wrote:
            ok i found it
  denoiser clear voice lol
  its a 50$ program.............as sonn as i have money on my CC, im going to try it out!
   
   
  THANKS REALLY!
  im sure ill need alot more help once i get it too lol
   
  amy

Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
        Your welcome. You dont need a class Amy. I know how frustrating it can be. When I first started the others would help me too. Then "they" sent me on a wild goose chase one day sending me a message for someone in the group and said give this to Paul. I sent it, he only heard static. So I used a new program I had just run across called clear voice denoiser and in the process of playing with his file I found some settings which solved all of my cleaning up problems. Plus it uncovered other voices I couldnt hear before. Thus the "paul" filter was born
   
  I would literally get headaches at the end of all of my sessions by trying to figure out how to clean them. Once I lucked upon the right filters, havent had a headache since. They also gave some hints for what settings to use a few times but I didnt understand what they meant until later.
  
 
  To get ya started heres the paul filter. I usually set it under options to amplify X 15.
   
  I am also sending some of the other filters (paul2 paul3 mistyxx) because after they had me play with some settings I realized sometimes those multilayer voices have other voices you cant hear underneath them. Just download them and save them then once you have clear voice denoiser installed just stick them in the denoiser folder with the rest of its filters. You will then be able to use them once you start the program it will list them under "professional" when you click that button.
   
  Alot of people dont think using filters is good. They want all of thier evp's to be "class A" or they wont even bother with it. I on the other hand never go for the class A type, even tho now and then I get them and I am happy to have gotten it, I use the system I set up with those on the other side as the "norm" because they go by these guidelines now too. I still only record for 30 seconds which is just right for the demo of Clear Voice. And they pack alot into that 30 seconds so the multilayers are at different speeds now rather than they all talk at once I slow it down to -74 in audacity to hear some of my groups messages. I also asked them to speak one at a time and they now try and do that rather than a room full of people all speaking at once.
   
  I know this was a private email, but only because it was too large to send all the files to group. I am now sharing the filter part with the group in case anyone else wants them.
   
  Misty
Amy Swanson <lon3_s7ar@...> wrote:
    thank you!!! !!!! !!!!!
  some of them sound like the dryer just clanking, others sound as authentic voices. I really need to find some sort of class on how to make these batter for me to hear, my way isnt really working at all
   
  thank you lots!!! i know taht takes some time to do !
   
   
  amy

Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
    Amy,
   
  It would have been easier with the original file LOL I dont know what ya did to it or how good these results will be but heres a buncha stuff i pulled from it after i had to cut it in 3 sections to try and work on it LOL
   
  Hope these help ya Amy, and you should start with the original CLR files and then work your way down thru the messages.
   
  Misty

Amy Swanson <lon3_s7ar@...> wrote:
        Frank or anyone available?
  Can you clean this up? When i clean it up i can hear something, but not getting it to where i want it! The background noise is A. me breathing B. A pair of jeans clanging in the dryer! lol
   
   
  amy
